title: Did the people from Baltic states try to escape the Soviet Union since the beginning of occupation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. And some really succeeded. Below - few most famous cases about Lithuanians who escaped the USSR hell. Jonas Pleškys Perhaps most famous case is Jonas Pleškys - who later became a prototype for captain Marko Ramius in the film The Hunt for Red October.[1]  Jonas Pleškys with his sister, Lithuanian actress, Eugenija Pleškytė in 1992.  In 1961, he sailed his vessel from Klaipėda to Gotland in Sweden, although his planned destination was Tallinn. The Soviet authorities sentenced him in his absence to death by firing squad, but the CIA hid him, first in Guatemala and later in the United States. Vladas Šakalys Vladas Šakalys crossed not only the Soviet border, but the whole Finland on foot, since Finland was returning refugees to the USSR. He felt safe only after he reached Sweden. [2]  During years 1951–1976, 17 successful Lithuanian escape cases known[3] Footnotes[1] the Man From ‘Red October’: Jonas Pleškys[2] Soviet Defector Describes Perilous Escape on Foot[3] Agnė Fabijonavičiūtė. Lietuvių gyventojų pabėgimai ir mėginimai ištrūkti iš Sovietų Sąjungos

Of course they did. There is a reason why do we have so many Canadian Latvians, American Latvians, Swedish Latvians… As many as 200 thousand refugees escaped from Latvia alone[1] and who knows how many did not manage. Most displaced Latvians in 1945 were in Germany at first, but most eventually left Germany, with 13 000 remaining. The countries of destination were as following: United States (55 000), Australia (21 000), Great Britain (18 000), Canada (14 000) and Sweden (4 000), with 13 000 remaining in Germany… (from LNVM archive) Footnotes[1] National History Museum of Latvia
Yes, of course. But even more of them escapes from Baltic states now. People always want better life and more money, that’s why.
There were riots/revolutions in East Germany, Poland, Hungary, Czechoslovakia during the Cold War. Many citizens of those states used the opportunity to escape to the west at the time.
